Author: artem.pikulin#0794
Content: @Slyris Hi! TCP is default protocol used, if specific electrum address requires SSL it will be shown in coins repo: https://github.com/jl777/coins/tree/master/electrums since commit: https://github.com/jl777/coins/commit/21597cef15d95d1835fb9ee47255f3ef930bfab8 As I can see there're no servers that use SSL as of now.

Author: Slyris#2880
Content: Ok great @artem.pikulin thank's

Author: cipi#4502
Content: NMC is using SSL: https://github.com/jl777/coins/blob/master/electrums/NMC

Author: Slyris#2880
Content: Thank's.

Author: barv#0867
Content: I noticed today that on the low volume CCL chain a tx can take long before being dpow secured as we have on demand mining turned on. Is there a way to address this?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it should actually go pretty fast. how long is "take long"

Author: barv#0867
Content: It went fast to 5 confirmations. Then 1 hour for number 6. Now I sent antother tx and it proceeds to 8

Author: barv#0867
Content: https://ccl.explorer.dexstats.info/tx/7d4b5756543af37dfc462b7e6fa3d4365090531f35ee63eb3a72b95e292ac989

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but how long did it take to get notarized?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: 5 confirmations, if "confirmations" field means it was notarized. how many confirmations are you waiting for

Author: barv#0867
Content: Ah, I didn't think it was at 5. I figured 10 which it reaches now, after 4 to 5 hours

Author: barv#0867
Content: thx @Deleted User that is a solution indeed

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: CCL doesn't have many regular txs. There was 1 notarization a min ago. Follow what Emmanuel said and use cronjob to send tx to self every few mins

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: You can send 0.0001 to self which would be very low cost

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but why do you want to get more confirmations?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: once its notarized, its notarized

Author: barv#0867
Content: @jl777c I don't. I just don't want it to 'stop' before it is dpowed

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: did it stop before it was notarized?

Author: barv#0867
Content: >> once its notarized, its notarized

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if it reported "confirmations" as more than 1, it was notarized

Author: barv#0867
Content: exactly. after that I don't care

Author: barv#0867
Content: Okay. That is good. So on demand mining makes sure a single tx gets notirised, and then it sleeps again?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: on demand mining doesnt guarantee it will get noarized right away, but most of the time it should

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if it reported "confirmations" as more than 1, it was notarized

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so you can see if it was notarized or not

Author: barv#0867
Content: Okay. I suspect we will have days with just 1 transaction. And I want to prevent them to be not dpowed within say 15 minutes. Should we then make this cronjob or is that unnecessary?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if it reported "confirmations" as more than 1, it was notarized

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: is it reporting it as notarized or not? how often is it stuck at 1?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: why do you think there is a problem?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if it reported "confirmations" as more than 1, it was notarized

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: 5 is more than 1

Author: ùôäùôûùô£ùô†#3612
Content: Just call a script on blocknotify that sends dust to yourself until the original transaction is notarized.

Author: barv#0867
Content: I am just trying to find out how this on demand mining works. I now know there wasn't a problem (but I just thought there was)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if there are no transactions in the mempool, no blocks are mined

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that is ondemand blocks

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if you can find cases where a transaction is not notarized, then let us know

Author: barv#0867
Content: Yes. So with only 1 tx a day you have a problem?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: why?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: does it get notarized?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if it gets notarized, 1 tx per year is still notarized

Author: barv#0867
Content: Because it will be out of the mempool once processed and then you have to wait for the next right?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: are you just making up problems based on guessing?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: once there is a transaction that isnt notarized, then it should most of the time trigger a notarization

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: which puts another tx in the mempool

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: which gets mined

Author: barv#0867
Content: I try to understand the 'most of the time'

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: notarizations are not 100% guaranteed

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it might not happen

Author: barv#0867
Content: and the only way to avoid that is more tx?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: https://komodostats.com/

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that shows CCL was notarized 4 blocks ago

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: just send a tx once per hour

Author: barv#0867
Content: okay thx @jl777c @Deleted User
